content:
Yes, there are several examples of bands and musicians who have been using virtual reality technology to enhance their performances. For instance, the English band Gorillaz used virtual reality technology to create a virtual version of their 2017 music festival, "Demon Dayz," which was streamed live on YouTube. The virtual reality version of the festival allowed fans to experience the event in a 360-degree immersive environment.

Another example is the American DJ and producer, Marshmello, who performed a virtual reality concert in Fortnite, a popular online video game, with an estimated 10 million viewers taking part in the event.

Lastly, the Icelandic singer Björk used virtual reality technology to create the music video for her 2015 single "Stonemilker." The video allowed viewers to experience the song in a 360-degree environment on a virtual beach in Iceland. 

Such examples are just some of the ways in which musicians are incorporating virtual reality into their performances to provide their fans with a unique and immersive experience.
